```{r setup, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(fig.width = 7, echo = FALSE)
library(ochRe)
library(dichromat)
library(colorspace)

```

# Introduction

"Welcome to all people... To this land of ochre" - Ruby Hunter

The [**ochre**](CRAN link?) package contains colour palettes inspired by the Australian landscape, iconic Australian artists and images. 

# Installation

``` r
install.packages("ochre")
```

**Or the development version**

``` r
devtools::install_github("ropenscilabs/ochre")
```

# The Palettes

The package contains fourteen colour palettes.

Usage
-----

```{r use_names, echo=TRUE}

# See names of all palettes
names(ochre_palettes)
```

```{r see_palettes, fig.height = 8}
pal_names <- names(ochre_palettes)

par(mfrow=c(7, 2), lheight = 2, mar=rep(1, 4), adj = 0)
for (i in 1:length(ochre_palettes)){
    viz_palette(ochre_palettes[[i]], pal_names[i])
}
```


## Colour blindness check
These plots show how each of the palettes perform for different types of colour blind, using dichromat. Recommended palettes are galah, namatjira, williams pilbara, and healthy reef  

### Green-Blind (Deuteranopia)
```{r dichromate_deat, fig.height = 8}
par(mfrow=c(7, 2), lheight = 2, mar=rep(1, 4), adj = 0)
for (i in 1:length(ochre_palettes)){
    viz_palette(dichromat(ochre_palettes[[i]], "deutan"), pal_names[i])
}
```


### Red-Blind (Protanopia)
```{r dichromate_protan, fig.height = 8}
par(mfrow=c(7, 2), lheight = 2, mar=rep(1, 4), adj = 0)
for (i in 1:length(ochre_palettes)){
    viz_palette(dichromat(ochre_palettes[[i]], "protan"), pal_names[i])
}
```


### Blue-Blind (Tritanopia)
```{r dichromate_tritan, fig.height = 8}
par(mfrow=c(7, 2), lheight = 2, mar=rep(1, 4), adj = 0)
for (i in 1:length(ochre_palettes)){
    viz_palette(dichromat(ochre_palettes[[i]], "tritan"), pal_names[i])
}
```


### Desaturated
```{r desaturate, fig.height = 8}
par(mfrow=c(7, 2), lheight = 2, mar=rep(1, 4), adj = 0)
for (i in 1:length(ochre_palettes)){
    viz_palette(desaturate(ochre_palettes[[i]]), pal_names[i])
}
```

### namatjira_qual and namatjira_div

These palettes are based on the painting "Twin Ghosts"" by Albert Namatjira. Each palette has eight colours.

![alt text](http://www.menziesartbrands.com/sites/default/files/field/catalogue_items//DM_24017.jpg){width=50%}


### mccrea

This palette is based on the painting "Melbourne, Collins St, 1841" by Georgiana McCrae. 
It has eleven colours.   

![mccrea](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/c/c0/Melbourne_Collins_Street_1841.jpg){width=50%}

### parliament

This palette is based on based on the tapestry in the Great Hall of Parliament House, of a landscape by Arthur Boyd - Untitled (Shoalhaven Landscape), as well as the colours of the and House of Representatives and the Senate. 
It has eight colours.   

![Untitled (Shoalhaven Landscape)](https://www.aph.gov.au/~/media/06%20Visit%20Parliament/66%20Parl%20House%20Art%20Collection/661%20five%20treasures/five%20treasures%20detail%20pics/M19840057UntitledBOYDunframed.png?la=en){width=50%}  
  
Parliament House:
https://www.peo.gov.au/learning/closer-look/australias-parliament-house/a-place-for-the-parliament.html  

### tasmania
This palette is based on colours in the bay of fires and cradle mountain.
It has seven colours.

### nolan_ned
This palette is based on the painting "Ned Kelly", 1946, by Sidney Nolan.
It has five colours.


![Ned Kelly](https://cs.nga.gov.au/images/lrg/28926.jpg){width=50%}
